New Records: The Dodgers achieved their largest shutout victory margin in postseason history with an 8-0 win over the Mets
Key Match Events: Shohei Ohtani hit a 397-foot three-run home run in the 8th inning
Enrique Hernandez and Max Muncy each homered, contributing to the Dodgers' 8-0 victory
The Mets had a bases-loaded opportunity in the 2nd inning but failed to score
Pre-Game Insights: The series stood at 6-3 in favor of the Dodgers before Game 3
The Mets had previously defeated the Dodgers 7-3 in Game 2
Dodgers' momentum was a key factor in their strong performance
Post-Match Reflections: The Dodgers' starting pitcher Walker Buehler had 6 strikeouts in 4 innings
The Mets needed more production from Pete Alonso, who was struggling at the plate
Miscellaneous Highlights: The game was the 10th meeting between the Dodgers and Mets in the 2024 season
The Dodgers dominated the game from the start, silencing the home crowd at Citi Field
